text:
Webservices (SOAP) sampler seemed to fail to generate *any* Listener data in JMeter 2.3.*2*. So we upgraded to 2.3.*4* which now shows active data in Listeners.

The problem in JMeter 2.3.*4* is that the messages do not seem to be sent. We have a webservice listening on localhost:8020 and connection attempts can be monitored in realtime. With 2.3.2's Webservices (SOAP) sampler, these attempts could be seen; with 2.3.4's HTTP Request sampler, they can be seen, but with 2.3.4's Webservices (SOAP) sampler, they are not received at all.
creator: mail_4brad@yahoo.co.uk

text:
Check the jmeter log file - is there anything relevant there?

What does the View Results Tree Listener show?

Have you put the JavaMail jars in the lib directory?
creator: sebb@apache.org
mail_4brad@yahoo.co.uk
text:
Thanks Sebb

JavaMail - that was it. I had installed the jars for my 2.3.2, but not for my 2.3.4. Couldn't there really be an enhancement to notify when these are missing as it must be such a common problem?

Not a defect - closed

creator: sebb@apache.org
text: The missing Javamail jar is already noted in the jmeter.log file, and will be seen in the View Results Tree Listener. Try it again and see.

creator: mail_4brad@yahoo.co.uk
text:
Quite right, but with so many listeners to choose from, new users likely wouldn't have had that particular one set up. I was thinking more of a dialog if the jars aren't found. Don't know how the code's designed though, so...?

Sorry to waste your time.
